title: Choose activities screen almost unusable
text: I had high hopes and signed up for free trial.  Disappointed that the simple act of adding an app to block almost made me give up due to the Choose Activities screen crashing or locking with almost every attempt to use it.  It seems the issue is known given the message that pops up sometimes.  I don’t understand how a highly rated app could have such a big issue with such an integral function.

title: Mixed feelings…
text: Don’t get me wrong, the app did help me lower my screen time… on one app. but I can’t get the payed version so there really is no point. It would help a lot if they just made it so the free version could have even just 1 or 2 more apps to block for free.

title: Keeps crashing
text:
This app has great potential. I’m currently on the plus version and just trying the trial but I don’t think I can keep it. 

I keep trying to add apps to block and it keeps crashing. I’ve tried restarting the app, restarting my phone, doing anything and everything and it won’t work!

title: Can’t add apps
text: App crashes everyone I try and add an app to the list, so it’s kinda worthless at the moment. Love the concept, though. Too bad it doesn’t work at all.

title: Scam
text:
It’s a trap.

You login, it tells you that there is one week of free trial before it will auto enroll you and charge $49. There is no button to cancel the membership. If you delete the app you will still be charged. It won’t show up in settings>>subscriptions until after you are charged. What an annoying hassle to have to call Apple to fix it.

title: So far, so good
text: I’ve been using it for about a week now and my screen time has dropped about 3.5 hours. I never realized how much time I spent on Facebook and Instagram just scrolling because I was bored. Only wish I could get the notifications of when I’m tagged in stuff, but I guess that would make me want to use it more.

title: Great app minus one missing feature.
text: I’ve been using this app for almost a year and love it. It has really reduced my usage of certain apps and I’ve been happy with it. There is one feature that I’d like to see which is syncing between devices. When I pick up my phone and use one instance of Instagram for the day that should sync to my iPad as well so I can’t game the system. If that feature was added to sync setup between devices as well as time used this would be the perfect app.

title: Amazing
text: Cut down my screen time. I would recommend to all people

title: Very confusing UI
text:
Idk all the ads show this push up to unlock feature, then it’s buried in challenges. Times per day is weird.

I literally just want to do pushups and unlock apps. It’s trying to do too much.

title: It's a great app.
text: I love it -I've been using it for about a month now, and it has completely changed my screen time and exercise routine routines.    I can do 75 push-ups.   lol.   Really it's a great app. It's not too restrictive. It does allow you to shut it off or pause it.   I think it's a perfect solution for doomscrolling.

title: New updates mean a useless app
text: Doesn’t even work anymore, cannot create challenges

title: All apps stop working
text: I started the push up challenge. After a few days all the social apps quit working until I deleted clear. Maybe it’s a bug.

title: Great, on a trial considering yearly sub, but…
text: Really great app. I am on a trial of it and it helps me not scroll so much and earn the scrolling time when I desire forces you to put in the work to have the time that you need to end and leisure, but I’m considering the family, apparently the family plan and cannot find any information on how many userscan utilize the family plan. Search the app search the reviews a little and searched online and can’t find that information.

title: Great but clunky
text: Have really been appreciating this app. In the last few weeks I've definitely been on my phone less and also have done a lot more push-ups. However the interface to spend minutes on an app can be slow and unresponsive at times. There have been multiple occasions where it makes my entire phone laggy and slow and I have to stop using it for a few minutes. This happens maybe 10-20% of the time.

title: Limited Results
text: The application does its job and limits apps you select for the challenge. The only problems:  you can only have 1 challenge going at a time. All the apps you want to lock up are under the same restrictions even if you want to split them. You are also limited to push-ups, squats and steps. I would love to see an expansion of more exercises.

title: ClearSpace helped me cut back on instagram usage, but cuts back with yearly fee
text:
I want to be clear, this app has worked wonders for me, and does what it’s set out to do.

However I’m frustrated by the fact that they give you a tool to help consume social media in a healthier manor, but charge you a subscription for it. Like what is this app doing that warrants a subscription? 

A one time fee, sure, absolutely even! I’m all for supporting a developer, but this is predatory. 

On top of all of that, they collect data on you as clearly laid out by their App Store page.

In the end I went with One Sec since it allows a lifetime purchase so I don’t feel like I’m locked in to a subscription for the rest of my life, and they don’t collect any data on users

title: It’s a Gym Membership lol
text:
366 squats, 140 push-ups, 185 deep breaths in a few weeks. 
Average daily phone usage went from 8h in December 2024 to 3.5h in February 2025. 
It’s hella working, dawg. 💖

title: Worth every penny
text: So far so good.  I’ve been able to cut down apps that I’ve used too often and it has allowed me to focus more.

title: It has worked for me!
text: I am using this for Instagram. My screen time has gone down significantly.  Instead of being on it for hours a day, I have only used it for a max time of 30 minutes per day. I am more clearheaded and better focused. Thank you ClearSpace.

title: Live in the moment
text: I thought I was actually pretty good compared to most of my friends but I did this to be more productive and put limits on myself to see how I was. Let me tell you that this frees up more time than you will ever believe. You pop in and out of the app and get that little craving you need but don’t get caught in an hour of reels. Use this app for a week and you will quickly see how much time you waste per day believe me.

title: Got my life back
text:
I’ve been so scattered, wasting so much time
Doom scrolling. I’m back to reading and being productive

title: Great App!!!
text:
I love this app.  I’ve significantly reduced selected screen time and am also doing lots of pushups to earn minutes. 

It works if you want to get better and aren’t a lousy quitter. 

I’m pleased to share that I called their number and a nice human answered my call. He heard my request to integrate data from other measurables (oura, whoop, etc…). I feel like an hour of Jui Jitsu is worth a few minutes of screen time…

He coined the phrase, ‘roll to scroll’…

:-)

title: Did the trick
text: Just the right amount of friction to avoid getting sucked into social media. It worked instantly. A few bugs that force you in loops but not terrible.

title: Best out there
text: I have tried all of the options out there are ClearSpace is absolutely the most innovative and effective. Thanks for making something so useful.

title: Life changing
text: Gained back 20-30 hours a week and motivated me to massively improve who I am. 480 day streak and counting thank you ClearSpace!

title: So helpful!
text: This app has truly helped me monitor & control how many times a day I use social media. Really recommend this  app!

title: Seriously worth every penny !
text: I do NOT pay for apps, but this was so worth it. (I also don’t leave reviews) but now I’m Over 70 days in and I went from hours of social media to minutes since day one. I feel like I paid 50 dollars for my life back. I’m more present with my children. I spend quality time with my husband, I am actually learning Spanish like I’ve been saying I’d do for years. I’m reading the Bible daily, like I’ve been saying I’d do for years. As someone with raging ADHD, I found I’m definitely a doom scroller and for me, this was my cure !

title: Amazing!
text: This app is a game changer! Best of all, getting  workout in as well.

title: What the world needs
text:
I’m not a social media person. But I still do have apps I turn to mindlessly. ClearSpace really helps break the cycle and recognize that I may be reacting needlessly to “boredom” or a moment of silence. Many people could benefit from making more space and noticing their reactivity!
This app was recommended to me by Art of Manliness.

title: Very useful
text: Other apps are either too restrictive or too athletically pleasing to be useful. This allows me to discipline myself and check my motivations for opening my phone. It has user decided time limits with user decided amount of times you can open the app per day instead of a certain amount of time you have for the app all day. I appreciate the structure of it and it inconveniences me instead of removes access entirely. For me, at the moment this is the best choice for needing my phone and battling my dopamine addiction at the same time.

title: Very useful if it’s hard to stop scrolling
text: It helps a lot to stop wasting my time and to take social media in a responsable way

title: Cost
text: For $50 a year it is absolutely ridiculous that I cannot add my spouse and a child onto the same plan! 🙄

title: Just hard enough!
text: You make it just hard enough for me to go to FB that I chose shorter times, exercise and think twice before addictive going to social media. TY!

title: Great app but don’t see myself ever doing multiple apps
text: I think this app is great but I think you are leaving a lot of money on the table by charging so much for multiple apps. I don’t see myself ever upgrading at its current price point.

title: We need this feature
text: We need feature that we can’t delete the app thanks for the work. Your app is amazing but we need also to block at least two apps instead of one addiction is bad and you are the only one who can help we need you thanks.

title: get this mf app
text: this app changed my life like really really changed it. i went from 6+ hours a day on various apps but mostly instagram to spending MAX 30 min/day on instagram, and usually 10-20. when the app glitches and lets me onto my apps (sometimes when i turn my phone on it happens, idk why but i prob need to update) i am back on instagram with a vengeance and literally use it for hours. i feel uncomfortable with the idea of not having this app working for me on my phone because it’s so effective for me. the way it boots me out of the app without a chance to extend the time is what does it, and having a limit of 3 times through the day i can check instagram- it turns out that’s plenty. i love it and owe hours of my life to it. you should def get it

title: Recover your time
text: Markedly reduced my screen time.  The phrases make you think twice before losing precious time.

title: Apple bug makes the app useless
text: When I first downloaded ClearSpace, I was able to add apps to block. I found the app useful, so after the seven day free trial I paid for the app. However, immediately after that a major part of the app stopped working. I am no longer able to add apps to block. Whenever I try, a window pops up that says the screen has crashed because of a known bug that has been reported to Apple. This has persisted for over a month now. I have written the company twice to ask about this and request a refund, since the app is useless if I can’t add apps to block, but no one has responded. This is starting to feel like a scam. DO NOT PAY FOR THIS APP, especially if you are an iPhone user.

title: Best way to wean off social
text: This is probably the best purchase I have made this year. I’ve decreased my social media use drastically which has increased my attention span and my happiness. And oh yeah, 500 squats and 300 push-ups. 💪 Thanks ClearSpace!

title: Crashes repeatedly
text: I was really looking forward to trying this out but it crashes upon selecting apps 100% of the time.

title: Great idea, but too buggy to justify a purchase
text:
I have been using this app for the pushup challenge, which has helped to reduce my screentime for certain apps, but it is impossible to block many apps due to a buggy integration with the iphone’s native “screen time” thing. If you try to block an app under the category “other” or use the search bar to find apps you want to block it will crash. Also, it does not support blocking certain websites which is really important for me. 

I still get a lot of value out of this due to spending less time on social media apps, but I can’t really justify paying for it unless they fix the bugs.

title: Improve push up tracking
text: Push up tracking needs improvement. Pretty good but sometimes doesn’t track

title: Feeling good!
text: Feeling much better being off my screen and limiting time

title: Have tried a ton of these apps and I like this one best!
text:
Unfortunately I’m not able to use the coolest feature of this app — the exercise “challenges” to unlock addictive apps — because I’m paraplegic and all of the exercises require the use of legs. So I can’t speak to how well that feature works.

Regardless, I’m going to pay for ClearSpace once the free trial is over. There are small details that make this app more effective (for me, at least) than others like it. For example, ClearSpace you pick how long you want to use the app at a time (from 1-10 minutes) right as you open the app. Then, when time runs out, it says, “the time you set aside for this app is over.” Theoretically I could unlock the app again but I never do…because the app is reminding me that I picked that shorter time (I usually pick 5 minutes, never 10), so I feel compelled to stick to it! I don’t know if that explanation fully makes sense, but trust me, my time spent on social media apps is WAY down since I started using ClearSpace!

title: Hi
text: Wish you could do more than 1 apps for free

title: Good but push up challenge needs work
text: Mostly great for limiting my social media time. Push up challenge needs work as it didn’t capture all my push ups even though my full body was in the camera…did 20 push ups for the app to only register 2 lol

title: Awesome app
text: This has really helped me to end just a bored habitual scrolling. It has helped me focus on using social media apps with purchase. My usage is down 68%

title: App doesn’t work
text: I paid for this app (a full year unfortunately) and it simply doesn’t work. It always crashes, you can’t block certain apps, and the email for customer service doesn’t work (got an email saying the email account doesn’t exist-for the account they list)

title: This app is a good deed for mankind
text: Huge help for my productivity and mental health. Absolutely necessary. Good deed for mankind

title: This app is a good deed for mankind
text: Huge help for my productivity and mental health. Absolutely necessary. Good deed for mankind

title: Must have!
text: A must have for anyone who wants to live with more intention, succumb less to impulses and mindfully determine the quality of your day and behavior.

title: BEST APP OF ALL TIME
text: I am not paid to say this or have any affiliation with this company but this was one of the best decisions I’ve made in a long long time

title: It’s comlplicated
text: I could give it 4 stars since there are ways around the blocks, but it accomplishes MY primary goal - spend less time on Socials. It’s enough of a barrier, even though I can adjust it and get around it, it has still significantly reduced my time spent scrolling nonsense. That deserves 5 stars to me.

title: No monthly options
text: $50 a year and no way to a monthly subscription.

title: Life changing
text: Incredibly helpful getting me out of habitually opening social media.  The best app I’ve downloaded easily!

title: Super helpful
text: Just the pause before you habitually tap an app has been game changing. Broke my TikTok habit on day 1!

title: Noticeably more happy
text: Pretty much the title. This is the only app that’s effectively limited my screen time, and life is better for it.

title: Good concept. Not great.
text: I like the concept of push-up to use apps. Trading activity for screen time is smart. But the execution of how it functions isn’t great. My biggest annoyance that caused me to delete the app was the inability to pause the countdown timer. If I do 10 pushups and want to view YouTube for 10 minutes, I select the 10 min option. But if I don’t use the full 10 minutes of once, I lose that entire amount of time. Several instances where this became of huge annoyance.

title: Great!
text: So far it has helped me be much more intentional with my social media usage. I really need to know why I am going there and I give my self a time limit, so I do what I need to do instead of mindless scrolling. I love feeling like I have that under control again

title: Amazing
text: Wish there were more free features as I can’t afford to pay the subscription.

title: Great app!
text: I’ve only been using this app for a few days but I already notice a difference! It gives you that pause before opening a social media app which is very much needed. 10/10 recommend!

title: This works. I am so grateful.
text: The social scrolling had a death grip on me, but ClearSpace has helped me make it a habit to pause before opening my most addictive apps. I’m on a 112 day streak of sticking to my allotted time usage and it feels so good! I’m able to focus better and get more done IRL, and my anxiety from too much news/algorithm spiraling has all but disappeared. I feel like a human with a brain again. Worth every penny.

title: Helped me with my screen time
text: This app is great because it really helped me reduce my screen time while still staying in shape! It made me do push ups or squats for ever time I wanted to use for example instagram. Highly recommend

title: Great app
text: honestly, I only downloaded the app because I was on finals week and needed to pay attention but I stuck with it. if your goal or new year’s resolution is to not be brain rot or stuck to your phone all day, this is the app. although, if you want more than 1 app you’ll have to pay buttt there’s this other app who lets you use more than 1 and I 100% recommend it too. its name is Screen Zen so also keep that in mind.

title: Exceptionally Well Thought Through App
text: I have used the Apple Screentime function for years without any change in behaviors because it was just so easy for me to override any limits. There’s no pause to the behavior with the flow. But with ClearSpace it is very methodically designed to procedurally provide a forced slowdown to mindfully choose your next step, and then further establishes a next level time limit even if you choose to use the app in question. I LOVE that if I choose to use one of my locked apps I have pre-determined amounts of use each day and when I use it for the length of time I choose it locks back up again! This feature is gold for accountability and follow-through. After using the free version and now the free trial, I will be going with the subscription.  I feel like I am back in control of my phone usage, keeping all of the utilitarian benefits of my phone without the hazards. I was close to chucking it for a dumb phone, but with ClearSpace, I don’t feel like I have to make such an extreme change. Thank you!

title: Buggy and crashes
text:
I really love the idea of this app.  Its features seem super awesome and useful.  Not only that, but the format of the app is very intuitive and easy to use.

However, the app is extremely buggy, and prone to crashing.

I tried to set it up on both my iPad and iPhone.  however it did not seem to like being open on both my phone and iPad at the same time.  After a few tries it wouldn’t even open on my phone, without crashing.  

It also didn’t like it when I tried adding multiple apps, and crashed after the fourth app I added.  So after adding 4ish apps I had to back out and go back in to add more.

Again, it seems like a great tool to reduce screen time.  But very buggy at the moment.  I will definitely try it again after the next phone update.

title: So Helpful
text: I saw my daily screen time drop 3.5hrs/day after installing and actually blocking the apps I spent the most time on. I feel like I’ve gained control over my phone, without having to make it a brick with no fun apps or social media downloaded at all. This app really does help you practice moderation, and makes it so much easier than if you were doing it by yourself. I’ll probably keep the pro version of this for at least the next 5 years. I can’t recommend it enough!

title: Not Like the Rest of These Kind of Apps
text: This doesn’t just limit your screen time, it helps create habits organically & instantly changed the way I use social media. I set my limit to 6 opens a day for a total of 1 hour max. I used to spend about 2.5 hours a day on social media mindlessly scrolling. In the upcoming year I am switching to the push-up challenge setting to see if it works just as well for me. Thank you to the folks at ClearSpace for creating this.

title: Great app!
text: The only app that has truly made me reduce my screen time long term.

title: Doesn’t record pushups accurately
text: Waiting for a refund of my 7-day free trial. App doesn’t record pushups accurately

title: Thank you
text: Thank you

title: Actually worth it
text: I’ve been trying to limit my screen time for actual years but nothing sticks. I am truly addicted to my phone, and it doesn’t help that I have ADHD. This is the only thing that has worked. I love how I can still access restricted apps, so long as I do an exercise. This makes it impossible for me to spend 5-6 hours on YouTube and it forces me to prioritize my time so I’m actually using apps as I should! I also love that you can’t alter your settings until the challenge is over, and how you can sign up with people so there’s actual accountability. It’s been really annoying…but it’s saving my time. It’s been 3 days and my mental health has already improved a ton. Thank you creators of this app! 🙏🏼 I will be purchasing a subscription and telling everyone I know.

title: Great idea
text: I’d like to see a family plan and expose the monthly sub which isn’t accessible in the app. I want my kids to do push ups to use this app but there’s no family plan to enforce that

title: Changed my relationship with IG
text:
This is my first ever review but I just had to spread the good word. 

I have tried a bunch of these blocker apps and thought that there was nothing to do but go through cycles of deleting the app from my phone and downloading it again and over and over. This does successfully curb my thoughtless defaulting to IG, but it also allows for some intentional "mindless scrolling treat time" which is super important because I think draconian changes aren't sustainable long term. 

It genuinely has, over extended use, rewired my relationship to Instagram. Try it out ♥️

title: Great but glitchy
text: The free version with one app has been highly effective in curbing automatic social media use. I decided to try the free trial to add other apps that tend to be a time sink as well- however every time I try to search an app not automatically categorized by the app the whole page crashes. I would also love to be able to add websites more easily as I have removed apps from my phone but still find myself going to the site in a browser. I understand these can be linked to an app but do not bring up the prompts to use when you choose mindfully, which is challenging when you need to use the site for information etc.

title: Taking back my time
text: This app has totally helped me take back my time, forcing me to take a beat before impulsively opening social media. I also love the challenges that get my body moving in order to open the app - I only wish there was a setting to prompt exercise all the time, not just within challenges. I also wish there were options for longer duration use, as I use social media for my business and sometimes need to spend more time on Instagram editing reels or answering messages. Otherwise great app!

title: Pretty darn good
text: Def has some kinks to work out and needs some more settings to make things more flexible for users. That being said - has definitely kept me off certain apps significantly in just a few days. Maybe wont pay for the subscription until it’s been updated a bit more.

title: awesome
text: Only problem is it doesn’t detect pushups very well in low light, so no adding extra minutes when you should be in bed ^.^

title: Applies Safe Search mode with no way to disable
text: This app is great except it goes 9 steps too far. I want to be able to decide what I can and can’t search for. I downloaded to put restrictions on my Instagram usage not all aspects of my digital life. Give users control of the features. Don’t just automatically enforce safe search in Safari.

title: Push-up challenge WORKS!!
text: I’ve honestly spent way less time on Instagram thanks to this app, specifically the push-up challenge. And I have been doing many more push-ups!

title: Really cool app
text: The fact that I can do challenges with my friends is pretty cool about the app. The push up challenge is my favorite for now in the app.

title: Worth it
text:
I’ve used this app this year and it’s been a game changer for me!! Screen time limits never work for me because I just ignore them. For me I have 30 minutes of time on instagram and TikTok a day/only 3 opens per day. So I have to decide when I’m going to use them!

It’s made me a lot more intentional with my time on social media without giving them up because they do bring me joy too!

title: Great until you try to remove apps
text: Where are the settings? Where are the instructions? Where is the support? This app disabled my phone…

title: Obsessed
text: Love this app, such a clean product and has cured me of Instagram addiction

title: Good
text: The app is nice except I don’t like having to use the app I open in 10 minutes continuously. I often need to go into social media to post something or look up something. Meaning I’ll ADHD switch between it and another app during that time. I’ll end up on social for 4 minutes out of the 10 it allotted, meaning I end up having to use another of my allotted times to finish the task.

title: Challenges
text: The only thing preventing me from getting this app is if I could do all the challenges at once. Just doing push-ups or squats or steps at one time is too restrictive. Would love to be able to do all of them to earn minutes

title: Super effective!
text: Great tool for re-training my compulsive brain to stop picking up social media all the time. Huge time and headspace saver!

title: Needs work.
text: I think it’s a great idea but I will do 30 push ups and it barely recognizes half if them!! So they need to fix that. Also I’m tired of having to party a monthly subscription to fully use apps…

title: Only works some of the time
text: This app is incredibly effective…when the app is working. It is one of the glitchiest apps I’ve ever experienced. Half the time it doesn’t open correctly so I can’t even use the app. Sometimes it just never loads, which I guess is one way of stopping me from using social media. I really love the concept and I love this app when it works, but please please fix these glitches!!!

title: Thanks!
text: I’m looking forward to trying out the app! So far so good. I signed up for my first steps challenge. I hope you add sit ups in the coming releases.

title: Trial period
text: During the trial period I notice immediately improvements to my productivity. Please try this for yourself!

title: Reduced time on phone
text: This application creates obstacles to using addictive apps. It makes it inconvenient to use Facebook, Instagram, YouTube, etc. Inconvenient enough that I choose not to use it. It’s great. I’ve drastically reduced my time on my phone.

title: $50 a year???
text: Get real

title: Great for apps. Not easy to use for websites
text: Outreached to the tech team - no reply. Love the idea, love the app, wish the team would make blocking websites easy to use. And the five day notice reminder before renewal never came - or not somewhere I saw it. Take the final step. Make this work for me. Thanks

title: Very helpful and fun app
text: Really easy to use and fun. I like doing pushups now

title: Great app for helping mindfulness
text: I love that this app provides a small barrier so that you can be intentional about your time. The one fixed that I would prefer is a slight extension just to finish up typing something if need be, before closing the app

title: Not what I thought
text: The advertisement made it appear as if I would have to do push-ups to use my apps, but that’s just not the case apparently

title: Limited my Facebook mindlessness
text: It is helping me limit my time, wish the options included 15 or 20 mins but it is helping me to really think of I want to use the app or not.

title: It’s just bad
text: I saw the adds with the push-ups for 1 minute and thought it would be fun but I spent 30 plus minutes trying to figure out how to set it up but I’m pretty sure you can only access it with the premium

title: Best app
text: I can honestly say it is the best app at what it does.

title: Works 👍
text: Works 👍

title: Take a Break
text: This is exactly what I needed to kick my incessant Facebook addiction. I love it!

title: Surprisingly effective
text: More helpful than I thought. Slows you down from dopamine response. Makes you question whether you want to use an app or budget uses for the day

title: Challenges are helpful
text:
Update: had to uninstall. Wayyyyyy too buggy. Froze my phone multiple times. Not sure what happened to the app. May try again in a few updates. Went with something else for now.

The push-up challenge has been immensely helpful. It really forces me to think about each precious minute I spend , that I had to do a push-up for, on social media.

Tip:
When doing the push up challenge, make sure your a couple of feet away from your phone. Tracks push ups much better if you keep a little distance between yourself and the phone.

title: Works well, very buggy
text:
This app has really helped my reduce my screentime. 

That being said - there are many times the app crashes when I’m trying to unlock an app for a session. Or it will hang on a blank blue screen.

title: Good over all
text: It’s an effective app, but I’ve gotten into the habit of ignoring the blocked apps for a day. I think they should make it harder to do that, or add some other way to get into the app. Like a puzzle or something you have to complete. Also I think they should add shortcuts thst activate or deactivate the blockage of an app, or turns on strict mode.

title: Genuinely helped me!
text: I hate how addictive scrolling can be—it’s such a productivity killer. I have had the built in iPhone screen limit on my account for over a year but my fingers were so used to just clicking ignore time limit that I still was on so often. I LOVE ClearSpace, those extra seconds that it takes to get into the app make me pause & realize I don’t actually want to login more times than not. I also love how it gives 1, 2, 5, or 10 minute options because I rarely want to be on for longer than that so it helps me get back to work or even just being present & enjoying life. 10/10 will & already have recommended! This thing works! I’ve cut my screen time drastically & my productivity had skyrocketed! Thank you ClearSpace!!!

title: Marker
text: It’s an excellent app, reinforces your discipline in a mindful way. ClearSpace is designed to make you pause and think insightfully and it does it in spades.

title: Time & Mindspace
text: Thanks for giving me back the time and mindspace social media was stealing from me.

title: Great but could be better!
text: I am grateful for this app and how it’s given me control over my screen time. I do think the camera tracker thing could be better.  It’s annoying when you’re doing pushups but it doesn’t record them. I also wish that it tracked my total pushups over time, perhaps showed my weekly trends.

title: Huge help!
text: This app has actually worked wonders in helping me limit my screen time and doomscrolling. I spend so much less time on social media and have been reading far more. I think my entire life is benefitting.
It locked my whole entire phone apps and I don’t know how to use the thing

title: Mindless Scrolling
text: Hey I am loving your app. You have given me the shift to get back on my fitness. I have went from mindless scrolling on FB to 18 minutes in the last 3 days. I am thankful that I found this app on my FB feed.

title: Breathe time limit
text: You can only set the breathing meditation thing for a max of 30 seconds! I feel like 2 minutes would be more helpful

title: Fast Results
text: This reduced my dependence on social media right away. I am impressed!

title: Absolutely brilliant idea
text: Such a smart and unique way to solve a common problem. Really excited to get further into it.

title: Helped my shopping addiction
text: I’ve been using ClearSpace for a week and it has reduced my average daily screen time from 7hrs to 3hrs. The annual subscription lets you limit more than one app, and for $50 a year it was worth it due to my shopping addiction. On top of that, I’ve had a much easier time focusing on work. I get more done around the house. I’m enjoying the outdoors more. If you really want to change your phone habits, I highly recommend this app.

title: loved this app
text: this app held me very accountable and prevented me from doomscrolling and the such, it’s that simple, the challenges are really fun and rewarding so i mean nothing to complain about

title: Need challenge codes
text: ClearSpace should offer several weekly challenge codes, it’s tough to find someone willing to pay for the app, and people who have paid can’t find community. I’ve checked, Reddit, IG, FB, TikTok, all the places I’m supposed to ban, I’ve spend 20 minutes looking for a challenge instead of doing pushups and squats

title: Best app
text:
This app costs like $30-50 dollars per year but saves me 2-3 hours/day. Multiplied by 365 that’s 700-1000 hours saved per year. Hormozi said…”poor people spend money on distractions” now you can spend money on an anti-distraction. 

In short couldn’t recommend an app any more

title: So helpful!!
text: ClearSpace is so effective. I immediately saw my unconscious habits. It was glaring! Ine gained so much awareness and control over my time on social media.

title: Great app. Great concept
text:
Easy interface.  Straightforward. Takes a little commitment to figure out wher/how to set camera up for pushups.  

Wish I could participate in multiple challenges at once (sometimes wanna squat, sometimes wanna push-up). Really well thought out app.

title: Such a wonderful app
text:
I like the challenges… 

the other day I did 200 squats which even surprised me… 100 in the am and 100 that night.

 I was hoping there was a way to combine the challenges because I switched from pushups up’s to squats and lost the progress I made but I learned to not do that quickly. 

Include burpees if it’s possible but I’m buying the app either way… it’s help me with NOT over using social media. 

Thank you

title: Love love love!
text: My screen time on TikTok was getting out of hand and this app single handedly saved me from doomscrolling on numerous occasions. I like that you choose the amount of time you’re going to spend on the app BEFORE you open it. So simple yet so effective.

title: Amazing - no more doomscrolling!
text: Since installing the app, my screen time has plummeted (except for Kindle). The pause before using and the time limits save my limbic brain from being hijacked by cute babies and puppies. Love it!

title: Great concept, needs some updates
text: Love the concept, and has reduced my screen time and scroll time drastically. However, it doesn’t count the push ups accurately. I often only get it to count 60-70% of the pushups I do, and get tired have to stop. Having done 25-40 pushups but only getting credit for 15-25. That needs to be fixed. Also needs more exercises or tasks for min. And don’t make them just 7day challenges, make it so I can select always have to earn min. Or I can pick ships or squats. And who gives an f about inviting friends to my challenges. Just let me choose any activity for min, depending on what I want to do.

title: Solid app
text: Love it, haven't paid for the full version yet but will be soon

title: Great app
text: I downloaded this app because I needed to reduce my time on my phone and to be more present and it has helped a ton. Great app

title: Effective
text: I needed this app! It stops me from doom-scrolling for long periods of time and has broken my habit of always opening Instagram when I’m bored. Now, I barely go on social media, and it’s made a huge positive difference in my daily life. I’ve recommended it to all my friends. Thank you for creating this!

title: Smart App, needs some tweaking
text:
I cut my screen time drastically by the constructive exercises needed to get into FB.  Breathing helped see the impulse to scroll as unnecessary.  It would be okay if I earned minutes for trying to login, but not actually using FB.
Vacation option was good.

 It would be nice to have a few emergency type access for selling items on FB marketplace.  I can’t very well do squats or pushups in public without looking like a clown.
Also, the set up for the centering exercises, was kind of clumsy. 

Thanks!

title: Sooo glitchy
text: I wanted to like it. I really tried. I restarted my phone. I closed the app multiple times. It wouldn't let me set apps for them to restrict. Can't get past, "This Apple screen has crashed. This commonly happens when searching for apps. We've reported the issue to Apple." I couldn't set websites up either. Told me it wasn't the time for that. 🤷🏻‍♀️I eventually got Messages set up. Tried to use it. App would freeze. Finally got through after multiple attempts. One message was from "John Smith". Wouldn't let me read it because John Smith wasn't in my contacts. Ummm...how did you know it was from John Smith if that name wasn't in my contacts?? They were def in my contacts.

title: PUSH-UPS DONT SAVE
text: I did 80 push-ups and my phone died, I opened it back up after charging my phone and everything was reset

title: love it and is genuinely helpful
text: i never write reviews but this app has legit been so helpful. i’ve used a ton of apps like this but none really did it for me, but since i’ve been using this i’ve been really good about not breaking my limit for opening tiktok. I’m feeling much more grounded and am spending more time doing things I enjoy than being on my phone.

title: Incredible
text: I completely adore the concept of this app; it’s doing SO many things right! From the different budgets to the motivational quotes, it rocks. I think I would prefer having the schedule be what times I can’t use the apps rather than can. I think that would make a lot more sense for students especially. Also, I wish strict mode would override schedules and sessions. I don’t wanna have to go through each app and change or delete a schedule just to put my apps on strict mode. Otherwise, love it!

title: Effective so far..
text: The app has really seriously helped me cut down on unwanted app time to an extent that I didn’t even expect. Between ADHD and a dopamine habit, I spend far too long on social media apps scrolling endlessly. I have almost cut that time down to nothing, just by obscuring the desired apps and making me think before opening.

title: Ridiculous
text: You can only restrict 1 app without paying $50 a year. I’m so tired of these “wellness” apps that are only out to get your money and are basically unusable without spending money.

title: It works!
text: After using this app for over a week to help limit the amount I use Instagram, I can honestly say it is incredible. You can easily customize your intake. I use it now three times a day for under 5 minutes each. I don’t miss it. The most powerful part of the app is that it has you complete a few steps before opening Instagram (or whatever app you are trying to manage). This causes you to consider whether you really need to be doing this with your time. It does not make you feel guilty. You must first open the notification you receive which requires you to take one deep breath. Then gives you a powerful quote to read and after you select whether or not you still want to visit the app. This step alone has made me rethink my choices. Finally you select how long you want to spend on the app. It’s a great product. Definitely recommend!

title: glitchy, frozen, limited features
text: at first i really liked this app and it helped me reduce my screen time. now, i experience major glitches, it freezes on me, and i often have to refresh multiple times to get to the meditation screen. i even paid for premium! because of the slow loading times and the app crashing, it makes it hard to turn on strict mode or even adjust the settings of apps i have restricted or would like to add as restricted. i would love to get a refund as it doesn't work as promised.

title: Love this
text: Love this app! Great for productivity in multiple ways. Hit more push ups than I ever have in a week and spent a record low amount of time on Instagram. A win win

title: Great
text: Great

title: Helps with being more intentional with my time!
text: I just started using the app, and I already have been using my phone a lot less. It has helped me not mindlessly scroll and be more intentional with my time!

title: Simple and effective
text: I needed a nudge to use social media less.  This helped me do that when I felt like I was having trouble being programmed to open it when I was stressed. So if you have unwanted phone use it’s a good way to nudge you back in the right direction

title: It’s helping!
text: Great app for helping to be more mindful of phone use throughout the day!

title: I really like it but
text: When I set up “Settings” as one of my clickable apps. It doesn’t take me to the main settings page. It opens up the “allow access” page in settings for my photos. Then I need to hit the back arrow to get to my main settings page. I’ll be happy to change my review if this is fixed. Other than that I am really enjoying this app! It’s exactly what I’ve been looking for. Can you fix this bug?

title: Best app so far
text: Best app I have tried with real impact so far

title: Good regulator
text:
If the only thing that keeps me off social media is taking a breath, maybe I don’t want to be on social media in the first place. 

For the developers:
I’ll delete the app the moment I need a work out or recipe from social media and the app gets in the way. I’d love a bypass setting (or make it intuitive if you’ve built one in already) for these events.

title: GOOD FOR ADHD
text: I usually close an app and then accidentally go right back to it and scroll when i don’t mean to. having this app makes me not want to be on social media cuz im too impatient to wait for the app to let me go on it so my scrolling habits are getting sooooo much better and way way less!

title: Absolutely perfect
text: This app has honestly changed my life for the better in a very short time. ClearSpace has helped me get off my phone more and stopped me from automatically opening social media apps like I used to every day. I no longer doom scroll, I read books. The app is seamless and I absolutely love the quotes it used to help me choose to not use the apps. Thank you ClearSpace for transforming my daily life and I look forward to using this app until I can completely phase the apps I don’t want to use anymore out of my life. Easy five stars

title: Turn screentime into getting jacked
text:
I downloaded this to break a Tiktok habit and now I’m doing 300 pushups / week what happened?

Great app
